project_title: Cloud-Native Todo Chatbot – Local Kubernetes Deployment
purpose: Deploy the Todo Chatbot application on a local Kubernetes cluster using Minikube, Helm Charts, with AI-assisted operations using kubectl-ai and Kagent, following a spec-driven, no-manual-coding approach.

agents.name: Specification Agent
agents.inputs: Phase III app requirements, existing Todo Chatbot codebase
agents.outputs: deployment-spec.yaml with components, ports, env vars, replicas, resources
agents.rules: No implementation details, focus on WHAT not HOW

agents.name: Planning Agent
agents.outputs: Ordered execution plan mapping steps to AI tools (Gordon, kubectl-ai, kagent)
agents.rules: Step-by-step plan suitable for AI execution

agents.name: Docker AI Agent (Gordon)
agents.authority: Container build lifecycle for frontend and backend
agents.inputs: Phase III frontend/backend code from existing repository
agents.outputs: Optimized Docker images for todo-frontend:latest and todo-backend:latest
agents.rules: Optimize size; tag for Minikube; no manual Dockerfiles creation

agents.name: Helm Generation Agent (kubectl-ai)
agents.authority: Generate Helm charts for Kubernetes deployment
agents.inputs: deployment-spec.yaml, container images from Docker AI Agent
agents.outputs: Complete Helm chart directory with templates, values.yaml, Chart.yaml
agents.rules: Parametrize images and replicas; use NodePort for frontend, ClusterIP for backend; follow Helm best practices

agents.name: Kubernetes Ops Agent (kagent)
agents.inputs: Minikube cluster state, deployment status, performance metrics
agents.outputs: Health analysis reports, optimization recommendations, resource utilization insights
agents.rules: Analyze resources, debug pod issues, suggest performance improvements

agents.name: Deployment & Validation Agent
agents.authority: Execute deployment and verify system integrity
agents.inputs: Helm charts from Helm Generation Agent, Docker images from Docker AI Agent
agents.outputs: Successful release on Minikube, access URL, validation report confirming system health
agents.rules: Verify pods in Ready state, services accessible, frontend operational, application functionality validated

workflow: Specification → Planning → Docker AI Build → Helm Generation → Cluster Analysis → Deployment → Validation
acceptance_criteria: All pods in Ready state with 0 restarts
Helm install successful with no errors
Health checks passing for all deployments
Application functionality validated through API tests
prohibitions: Manual creation of Dockerfiles, YAML manifests, or Kubernetes resources
Direct cloud deployment (must use local Minikube only)
Hardcoded credentials or secrets in plain text
Deployment to production environments without proper review
Manual editing of generated Helm charts or Kubernetes manifests
Skipping AI-assisted tools in favor of manual operations
audit_evidence: All specifications, plans, task lists, execution commands, AI-generated files, and validation reports must be logged and preserved in the project history for auditability and reproducibility.
amendment_process: Changes to this specification require Specification Agent revision and Planning Agent approval before taking effect, with proper version control and change tracking.
